gurmukhi: Aisq bsqR Aru Aisq gwq Aimqoj rxwcl ] Aiq pRcMf Aiq bIr bIr jIqy ijn jl Ql ]
transliteration: Asit Bastra Ar(u) Asit Gadj Amitoj Ranaadhaal|| At(i) Prachanndd At(i) Beer Beer Jeete Jal Thal||
translation: He has a black body and wears black clothes; he is infinitely glorious; he is extremely powerful and he has conquered many warriors in the battlefield;

gurmukhi: Akt AjY AnByd Aimt AnriQ nwm iqh ] Aiq pRmwrQ Ar mQn S`qR soKn hY biRd ijh ]
transliteration: Akat Ajai Anbhed Amit Anarth(i) Naam Tih|| At(i) Pramaarath Ar Mathan Shattra Sokhan Hai Brid Jih||
translation: He is invincible, imperishable and indiscriminate; his name is Anarth (misfortune), he is extremely powerful and is capable of destroying the gatherings of enemies;

gurmukhi: durDrK sUr AnByd Bt Aiq pRqwp iqh jwnIAY ] AnjY AnMd dwqw Apn Aiq subwh iqh mwnIAY ]198]
transliteration: Durdharakh Soor Aajaan Baah Aalok Roop Gad|| Matas Ket Lakh(i) Jaah(i) Hridai Laajat Hai Dout Man||
translation: He, who is the killer of tyrannical warriors, is considered extremely glorious; he is unconquerable, giver of pleasure and is known as extremely glorious warrior.198.

gurmukhi: mor brn rQ bwj mor hI brx prm ijh ] Aimq qyj durDrK S`qRu liK kr kMpq iqh ]
transliteration: Mor Baran Rath Baaj Mor Hibaran Param Jih|| Amit Tej Durdharakh Shattru Lakh(i) Kar Kanpat Tih||
translation: He is the master of peacock-coloured chariot and horses, is also peacock-coloured himself; seeing this Lord of infinite glory, the enemies tremble;

gurmukhi: Aimt bIr Awjwn bwh Awlok rUp gn ] mqs kyq liK jwih hiRdY lwjq hY duq mn ]
transliteration: Amit Beer Aajaan Baah Aalok Roop Gad|| Matas Ket Lakh(i) Jaah(i) Hridai Laajat Hai Dout Man||
translation: This imperishable warrior has long arms and is the producer of dazzling light; seeing his beauty, even the god of love feels shy;

gurmukhi: As JUT rUT jidn niRpiq rxih qurMg auQ`ik hY ] ibnu ie`k s`q sux s`q niRp su Aaur n Awn ht`ik hY ]199]
transliteration: As Jhooth Rooth Jadin Nripat(i) Ranah(i) Turan Outhakk(i)hai|| Bin(u) Ikk Satt Suoo Satt Nrip Su Aur Na Aan Hatakk(i) Hai||199||
translation: The day on which warriors named Jhooth (falsehood) will cause his horse to dance before you in great anger, then O king ! consider it as true, no one can defeat him except Truth.199.

gurmukhi: rx qurMg isq Aisq Aisq isq Dujw ibrwjq ] Aisq syqih bsqR inrK sur nr muin lwjq ]
transliteration: Ran Turan Sit Asit Asit Sit Dhujaa Biraajat|| Asit Setah(i) Bastra Nirakh Sur Nar Mounndi) Laajat||
translation: He, whose war-horse is black and white, whose banner is black and seeing whose black and white garments, the gods, men and sages feel shy;

gurmukhi: Aisq syq swrQI Aisq sy qCikE rQwNbr ] suvrx ikMknI kys jnuk dUsr dyvysur ]
transliteration: Asit Set Saarthiasit Se Tachhkio Rathaanbar|| Suvaran Kinkaniker Janouk Doosar Devesur||
translation: He whose charioteer is black and white and whose quiver and chariot aree alos black; his hair are like the golden chords and he seems to be the second Indra;

gurmukhi: ieh Cb pRBwv im`iQAw spq Aiq bilSt iqh khXo ] ijh jgq jIv jIqy sBY nih AjIq nr ko rhXo ]200]
transliteration: Eh Chhab Prabhaav Mithhiaa Sapat At(i) Balishat Tih Kah Kahyo|| Jih Jagad Jeev Jeete Sabhai Nah(i) Ajeet Nar Ko Rahyo||200||
translation: This is the impact and beauty of the warrior named Mighya; he is extremely powerful; he has conquered all the beings of he world and none has remained untouched by him.200.

gurmukhi: c`kR b`kR kr Dry cwr bwgw qn Dwry ] Awnn Kwq qMbol gMD au`qm ibsQwry ]
transliteration: Chakkra Bakkra Kar Ddare Chaar Baagad Tan Dhdare|| Aanan Khaat Taedhol Gaddh Bishdare||
translation: He is wearing the curved discus and fine garments on his body; he is chewing th betel leaf in his mouth and its fine odour is spreading on all the four sides;

gurmukhi: cvru cwr chuM Er Frq suMdr Cib pwvq ] inrKq nYn bsMq pRBw qwkh isr nXwvq ]
transliteration: Chavar(u) Chaar Chahoun Or Dharat Soundar Chhab(i) Paavat|| Nirakhat Nain Basant Prabhaa Taakah Sir Nyaavat||
translation: The fly-whisk is swinging on all the four sides and the setting is very fine; seeing him, the glory of spring bows its head;
